Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Model of a curved blade
Description: Model of a curved miniature blade that could represent the bow of the instrument used by carpenters to drill holes in wood: the bow drill. Found in a foundation deposit, the context suggests that it could be a simulacrum for one of the objects used during the construction of the temple.
